header: Cri.Bail Application no. 149/19 CNR No. MHPU01-000590-2019 ORDER BELOW EXH.1

background.text: 1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. no. 7/19 registered at Khadak Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354D of the Indian Penal Code and under section 12 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012.

arguments.text: It is alleged that victim aged about 17 years lodged report that on 05.01.2019 applicant i.e. friend of her brother followed her when she was returning to house from college and told her that he likes her and loves her, he thereby outraged her modesty.

argumentSentences.text: It is alleged that victim aged about 17 years lodged report that on 05.01.2019 applicant i.e. friend of her brother followed her when she was returning to house from college and told her that he likes her and loves her, he thereby outraged her modesty.

arguments.text: 3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter. He is taking education and permanently residing at Shukrawar Peth, Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

argumentSentences.text: 3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter.
He is taking education and permanently residing at Shukrawar Peth, Pune.
He is ready to abide the conditions.
Hence, he prayed to release him on bail.

arguments.text: 4] APP objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Applicant and victim are residing in same locality, so applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. So, they prayed to reject the application.

argumentSentences.text: 4] APP objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress.
Applicant and victim are residing in same locality, so applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses.
There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence.
So, they prayed to reject the application.

arguments.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is interrogated. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is resident of Shukrawar Peth, Pune. Applicant is student and his career is spoil if he remained in jail for unknown period. Applicant has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period. Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­

argumentSentences.text: 5] Allegations against the applicant are serious.
Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over.
Personal custody of applicant is not required.
Applicant is resident of Shukrawar Peth, Pune.
Applicant is student and his career is spoil if he remained in jail for unknown period.
No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period.
Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­

order.text: ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Prathmesh Laxman Tonde be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.20,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution witnesses in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Khadak Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not threat, pressurize the victim and shall not repeat the offence. 6] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 7] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number.

processedText:
Cri.Bail Application no. 149/19 CNR No. MHPU01-000590-2019 ORDER BELOW EXH.1 
---header-ends---
1] Perused application and say. Heard Advocate for applicant and APP for the State. 2] This is first bail application filed under section 439 of Cr.P.C. by applicant in respect of his arrest in C.R. no. 7/19 registered at Khadak Police Station for the offence punishable under section 354D of the Indian Penal Code and under section 12 of the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act, 2012. 
---background-ends---
It is alleged that victim aged about 17 years lodged report that on 05.01.2019 applicant i.e. friend of her brother followed her when she was returning to house from college and told her that he likes her and loves her, he thereby outraged her modesty. 
---argument-ends---
3] According to applicant he is falsely implicated in this matter. He is taking education and permanently residing at Shukrawar Peth, Pune. He has no criminal antecedents. He is ready to abide the conditions. Hence, he prayed to release him on bail. 
---argument-ends---
4] APP objected this application on the ground that investigation is in progress. Applicant and victim are residing in same locality, so applicant will pressurize victim and witnesses. There is possibility of tampering prosecution evidence. So, they prayed to reject the application. 
---argument-ends---
5] Allegations against the applicant are serious. Applicant is interrogated. Considering allegations and nature of offence investigation is practically over. Personal custody of applicant is not required. Applicant is resident of Shukrawar Peth, Pune. Applicant is student and his career is spoil if he remained in jail for unknown period. Applicant has no criminal antecedents. No purpose would serve by keeping the applicant behind bar for unknown period. Due to all above reasons application deserves to be allowed with following order ­ 
---argument-ends---
ORDER 1] The application is allowed. 2] The applicant Prathmesh Laxman Tonde be released on executing P.R. bond of Rs.20,000/­ with one or two solvent sureties in the like amount. 3] The applicant shall not tamper the prosecution witnesses in any manner. 4] The applicant shall attend Khadak Police Station on every Monday between 11.00 a.m. to 2.00 p.m. till the charge­sheet is filed. 5] The applicant shall not threat, pressurize the victim and shall not repeat the offence. 6] The applicant shall co­operate investigating machinery as and when required. 7] Prior to furnishing surety, the applicant shall submit his address proof, mobile number and inform about the change in address and mobile number. 
---order-ends---
Pune. (R.V.Adone) Date – 11.01.2019. Addl.Sessions Judge, Pune. “ I affirm that the contents of the P.D.F. File Judgment are same word for word as per original judgment. Name of Steno ­ S.V.Thakar, Court Name ­ Smt. R.V.Adone, Addl.Sessions Judge,Pune. Date of Order ­ 11.01.2019 Order signed by P.O. ­ 11.01.2019 Order uploaded on ­ 14.01.2019 3 Cri.Bail Application no. 149/19 CNR No. MHPU01-000590-2019
